alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, Orleans and southeastern St. Tammany Parishes through 430 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meraux, or near Chalmette, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Chalmette, East New Orleans, Belle Chasse, Lake Catherine, Violet, Meraux, Poydras and Arabi. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 242 and 254, and between mile markers 261 and 264. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Southeast St. Tammany
